It is clear Special Counsel Robert Mueller has more work to do. For the sake of our democracy, his investigation must be carried to completion and Congress must take immediate action to ensure the Special Counsel’s investigation moves forward without interruption or interference. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1068110895409233921 …

If confirmed, Farr would represent many of the same people he tried to disenfranchise. The counties in the Eastern District of NC have a large African American population. This is just one troubling reason why there is absolutely no place on the federal bench for Thomas Farr.
Thomas Farr then defended the campaign’s postcard scheme in 1992 when the Justice Department filed a complaint against the Jesse Helms campaign for its efforts to intimidate Black voters.
Thomas Farr served as an attorney for the Jesse Helms campaign during this time and reports indicate that Farr participated in the discussions about challenging voter residency.

In 1990, the Jesse Helms campaign engaged in a scheme to discourage voter turnout, sending postcards to more than 100,000 North Carolinians – mostly African Americans- warning that they might be ineligible to vote and could be arrested for voter fraud if they came to the polls.

The Senate is expected to vote today to make Thomas Farr a federal judge in North Carolina.

Who is Thomas Farr? For starters, he was a lawyer for then-Senator Jesse Helms’ campaign, where he defended the campaign in its efforts to disenfranchise African American voters.

Tomorrow the Senate will vote on perhaps the most objectionable federal judicial nominee yet. Thomas Farr built a career on voter suppression & defended a voter ID law that judges said targeted African Americans "with almost surgical precision." He should not be a federal judge. pic.twitter.com/tsmnMwwwMP

Just one day after Thanksgiving, Samuel Oliver-Bruno was abruptly arrested by ICE during a visit to the immigration office to check on his status. His arrest is alarming & inappropriate. I’m doing everything in my power to keep the family together while his case is adjudicated.

As we gather with our loved ones to celebrate Thanksgiving, I am reminded of all that we have to be thankful for and that the source of America’s greatness is its people. Wishing you and your loved ones a Happy Thanksgiving. -GKB pic.twitter.com/IUUX0nSjFo
I will do everything I can to stop this confirmation and will keep everyone updated. You can voice your concern to your senators as they will have a final vote on Farr's confirmation.
Thomas Farr is an extreme nominee whose record raises serious questions regarding his commitment to equal justice under the law. I will do everything I can to stop his confirmation.

P.S. - The Eastern District of NC has never had an African American judge in its 143-year history, despite having a large African American population. President Obama nominated TWO accomplished African American women for this vacancy (both were blocked by GOP Senators).
If confirmed, Farr would represent many of the same people he tried to disenfranchise. The counties in the Eastern District have a substantial African American population.
Thomas Farr went on to defend a shameful voter suppression law in NC- the same one that a federal court ruled targeted Black voters “with almost surgical precision."

Farr has a long record of defending voter suppression tactics such as voter intimidation and voter ID laws. He advised Jesse Helms’ campaign in the early 90s, which sent postcards to voters in heavily Black areas falsely informing them they could be arrested for casting a ballot.

ALERT: @SenateMajLdr Mitch McConnell is planning to hold a final vote on President Trump’s NC district court nominee Thomas Farr after Thanksgiving recess. I remain strongly opposed to his nomination.
